DataElement.preferredName: Contralateral Breast Maximum Radiation Therapy Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the maximum dose of radiation therapy in Gray units (Gy) delivered to the contralateral breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Contralateral Breast Maximum Radiation Therapy Dose
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: On or relating to the opposite side (of the body)_One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._the largest possible quantity or degree._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On or relating to the opposite side (of the body):One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time expressed in Gy (Gray) units.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center Radiation Dosimetry CRF in C3D.
